channel.title: Configure single sign-on on Docker Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Configure single sign-on on Docker Docs

item.title: Configure your IdP
item.description: The steps to set up your SSO configuration are: Add and verify the domain or domains that your members use to sign in to Docker. Create your SSO connection in Docker. Configure your IdP to work with Docker. Complete your SSO connection in Docker. This page walks through step 3 for common IdPs. Prerequisites Make sure you have completed the following before you begin: Your domain is verified You have created your SSO connection in Docker You have copied the necessary fields from Docker to paste in your IdP: SAML: Entity ID, ACS URL Azure AD (OIDC): Redirect URL SSO attributes When a user signs in using SSO, Docker obtains the following attributes from the IdP:
